availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles E. Hood (Boyd County, Kentucky, soldier)

body.p: Boyd County, Kentucky, soldier. Greenup County, Kentucky, native. Son of William P. Hood and Matilda Hood. Married to Amanda M. Hood in Carter County, Kentucky, on May 11, 1856. Father of Louisa A. Hood and John W. Hood. Farmer in Carter County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident of Boyd County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal and quartermaster sergeant from September 9, 1861, to October 12, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 2, p. 221B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, p. 719.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994030, Carter County Marriages, p. 5.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 018.
